caption: A gritty Southern rock track with slide guitar, Hammond organ, and gravelly male vocals. Features driving drums, bluesy guitar solos, and a swampy groove that captures the spirit of the American South.
lyrics:
[Intro]

[Verse 1]
Down in Louisiana where the cypress grows
Muddy water and the bayou flows
Got my guitar and a bottle of rye
Playing blues beneath the southern sky

[Chorus]
Swamp rock running through my veins
Washing away all my pains
This is where I belong
Singing my swamp rock song

[Verse 2]
Crawfish boiling gators in the creek
Been down here going on a week
No cell service and I don't care
Got everything I need right here

[Chorus]
Swamp rock running through my veins
Washing away all my pains
This is where I belong
Singing my swamp rock song

[Guitar Solo]

[Outro]
Swamp rock
Yeah swamp rock
